BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting discrimination based on one’s arrest record, pending criminal accusations or criminal convictions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting discrimination based on one’s arrest record, pending criminal accusations or criminal convictions.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing January 27, 2020 as Holocaust Remembrance Day and the week beginning on January 27, 2020 as a citywide week of Holocaust Education in New York City.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Recognizing January 27, 2020 as Holocaust Remembrance Day and the week beginning on January 27, 2020 as a citywide week of Holocaust Education in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting discrimination based on one’s arrest record, pending criminal accusations or criminal convictions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting discrimination based on one’s arrest record, pending criminal accusations or criminal convictions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting discrimination based on one’s arrest record, pending criminal accusations or criminal convictions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting discrimination based on one’s arrest record, pending criminal accusations or criminal convictions.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing January 27, 2020 as Holocaust Remembrance Day and the week beginning on January 27, 2020 as a citywide week of Holocaust Education in New York City.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Recognizing January 27, 2020 as Holocaust Remembrance Day and the week beginning on January 27, 2020 as a citywide week of Holocaust Education in NYC.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Deutsch and Public Advocate Williams
